meanings.definition: Move smoothly and quietly with gliding steps, in a stealthy or furtive manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat slinked through the shadows, hunting for its prey.
meanings.sent2: She slinked past the sleeping guard, careful not to make a sound.
meanings.sent3: The spy slinked around the corner, trying to avoid being seen by the enemy.
meanings.sent4: The fog slinked its way through the valley, enveloping everything in its misty embrace.
meanings.sent5: The dancer slinked across the stage, captivating the audience with her graceful movements.

meanings.definition: To move or go in a quiet, stealthy way, as if avoiding notice.
meanings.sent1: The thief slinked away from the scene of the crime, disappearing into the night.
meanings.sent2: He slinked out of the room before anyone could ask him any questions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat slinked up to the table and stole a piece of fish when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The shadows of the night slinked across the walls, casting eerie shapes in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The snake slinked through the grass, its movements barely making a sound.
